item.title: Danny Dyer hosts Have I Got News for You, review: guest host hits his stride with nimble wit and salty quips - The Telegraph
item.description:
Danny Dyer hosts Have I Got News for You, review: guest host hits his stride with nimble wit and salty quips  The Telegraph

“I forgot how highbrow this f***ing show is.” So said guest host Danny Dyer on Have I Got News For You(BBC One).The EastEnders star’s industrial language and nimble natural wit made for a uproarious installment of the hoary old satirical quiz. Roguish Cockney thesp Dyer has enjoyed a gratifying career turnaround in recent years, transforming himself from bargain-bin action hero to televisual treasure by virtue of his award-winning, soap-salvaging role as Queen Vic landlord Mick Carter and cockle-warming discovery of his royal roots on Who Do You Think You Are? Dyer also has new-found form f...

item.title: Love Island winners Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham split after six months - The Independent
item.description:
Love Island winners Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham split after six months  The Independent

Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham have announced their separation just over four months after winning Love Island 2018. After a whirlwind six-month relationship, Dyer revealed the news in a statement that she shared on her Instagram story. “Jack and I have sadly decided to part ways,” she wrote. - Read more Why girls should be able to watch ‘Love Island’ and still be feminists “It’s been an incredible six months, and we will always have a place in our hearts for each other, but sadly we’ve come to the realisation that it’s not meant to be long term. “We both plan to stay friends. I hope you’ll all...

item.title: Love Island winner Dani Dyer to pen advice book - Independent.ie
item.description:
Love Island winner Dani Dyer to pen advice book  Independent.ie

Love Island winner Dani Dyer has signed a deal for her debut book, in which she will offer advice and answer questions. In What Would Dani Do?, Dyer will share her experiences of growing up, bullying, relationships, insecurities and being soap star Danny Dyer’s daughter. She will also provide behind-the-scenes details from Love Island, where she met boyfriend Jack Fincham. Dani Dyer with Jack Fincham (Ian West/PA) The book will be published by Ebury Publishing on April 4 2019. The reality star said: “My followers are always asking me questions and advice on everything from family to boys t...

item.description:
Ten of the UK’s favourite tweets of 2018  Independent.ie

Twitter has released a collection of 10 of the most-liked tweets in the UK in 2018 so far. The collection illustrates some of the best, funniest or most heartfelt things which have struck a chord with UK users of the social media site since January. 1. ‘Slab-head’ inspires a meme “Can you ask the neighbours to put the bins out on Monday? item.description:
Danny Dyer obliterates Boris Johnson and Nigel Farage in latest Brexit rant  JOE.ie

Eternal voice of reason Danny Dyer is at it again You might remember a time roughlyfour months ago when Danny Dyer took on the lofty mantle of, simply, "Voice of Britain" and eviscerated pork boi David Cameron it what will eventually become known as the finest moment of oratory brilliance in the entire history of the modern world. It went a little something like this: *clears throat* "Nobody's got a fucking clue what Brexit is.You watch Question Time and it's a comedy.No-one knows what it is. It's like this mad riddle. No-one knows what it is right. So what's happened to that twat David Cam...

item.description:
Bon Jovi: Ex-altar boy Jon still living on a prayer  Independent.ie

Former altar boy John Francis Bongiovi - he changed it to Jon Bon Jovi when he formed a certain rock band in 1983 - was born on March 2, 1962. He was raised in Perth Amboy, a working-class New Jersey town, 30 miles south of New York - "close enough", as Jon once said, "to the centre of the universe, but far enough away where nobody was really watching". item.title: Danny Dyer goes on extraordinary rant about Nigel Farage and Boris Johnson - The Independent
item.description:
Danny Dyer goes on extraordinary rant about Nigel Farage and Boris Johnson  The Independent

Danny Dyer, man of the people, has unleashed his wrath on Brexiteers Boris Johnson and Nigel Farage, where he attacked the former foreign secretary for "spouting bollocks" and branded Farage "a p***k in a suit". Speaking to the Big Issue, the EastEnders actor launched an extraordinary rant on the current state of British politics, and lamented the "age of food banks". "Theresa May, bless her, just got that job by default," he said. "Boris Johnson running around with his stupid haircut spouting bollocks. Young people look and think: 'If these are the people running the country, why shouldn't...

item.title: Picoult takes on the abortion debate in timely new novel - Independent.ie
item.description:
Picoult takes on the abortion debate in timely new novel  Independent.ie

The timing of Jodi Picoult's latest novel couldn't be more apt. A Spark of Light chronicles a deadly shooting and hostage-taking in a women's health clinic at a point when, in America, Roe v Wade is at risk of being overturned as the Supreme Court moves decidedly to the right, following the controversial confirmation of Brett Kavanaugh, and in Ireland, a historic referendum prompted heated debates over abortion and the eventual vote to repeal the eighth amendment. Celebrities including Liam Gallagher, Danny Dyer and Michael Buble took part in Channel 4’s annual charity telethon on Friday ni...

item.title: Philomena Cunk on culture: ‘Danny Dyer should definitely be the next James Bond’ - The Guardian
item.description:
Philomena Cunk on culture: ‘Danny Dyer should definitely be the next James Bond’  The Guardian

Danny Dyer Danny Dyer is probably the greatest actor of his generation. Born Danial Dandy Dan D Dyer on his birthday in 1977, he rose to fame. His first big film appearance was as one half of the title role in Human Traffic. But he is probably best known for his tear-breaking performance as landlord Mick Carter in the never-ending TV drama EastEnders. Dyer brings his tremendous sensitivity and range to his work. In the epic romantic film Run for Your Wife, he brings everything you’d expect to the character of John Smith. And when he appeared as Danny Dyer in Who Do You Think You Are?, criti...

item.title: Hans, a Congolese dwarf and a provocative fairy tale - Independent.ie
item.description:
Hans, a Congolese dwarf and a provocative fairy tale  Independent.ie

The Bridge Theatre, London's newest state-of-the-art venue, has the world premiere of a punky fairy tale by London-Irishman Martin McDonagh as its autumn centrepiece, running through the Christmas season. There has always been a touch of the fairy tale about McDonagh, not least his meteoric rise to international theatre stardom and Tony awards with his debut play, and his Academy Award for his first short film. But apart from this, his realistic stage-work features its fair share of ogres, grannies and orphaned cripples, as well as the blunt narrative twists of the traditional fairy tale. T...

item.title: Stand Up To Cancer telethon raises more than £24m - Independent.ie
item.description:
Stand Up To Cancer telethon raises more than £24m  Independent.ie

More than £24 million has been donated in aid of cancer research following the Stand Up To Cancer television fundraiser. Celebrities including Liam Gallagher, Danny Dyer and Michael Buble took part in Channel 4’s annual charity telethon on Friday night. Presenters Alan Carr, Maya Jama and Adam Hills announced a total of £24.6 million had been raised on the night, with more donations still coming in. The programme, which featured celebrity sketches and comedy skits, also paid tribute to soul singer Aretha Franklin, who died from cancer in August, as Emeli Sande performed a version of Don’t P...

item.title: Danny Dyer shocks Celebrity Gogglebox viewers telling daughter Dani she 'would have been good' on Naked Attraction - Independent.ie
item.description:
Danny Dyer shocks Celebrity Gogglebox viewers telling daughter Dani she 'would have been good' on Naked Attraction  Independent.ie

Danny Dyer has told his daughter she "would have been good" on Naked Attraction. There was a star-studded line-up for a special Celebrity Gogglebox, and famous names were left emotional on the night of special Stand Up To Cancer shows. Liam Gallagher also appeared as part of the appeal, saying: "Take your pain, take your suffering, and do one. It's pay back time for all the pain." The EastEnders actor said he was wrong to advise against his daughter appearing on Love Island, which she won, and that she would be as successful on Naked Attraction. He said: "With Love Island I said you shouldn...

item.title: Danny and Dani Dyer to appear on Celebrity Gogglebox - Independent.ie
item.description:
Danny and Dani Dyer to appear on Celebrity Gogglebox  Independent.ie

EastEnders star Danny Dyer will join his Love Island-winning daughter Dani on Celebrity Gogglebox. The father and daughter team will appear on the Channel 4 show on Friday for Stand Up To Cancer, the annual charity telethon. Dani, who won ITV’s dating show Love Island this year with boyfriend Jack Fincham, confirmed the news on Instagram. View this post on Instagram I absolutely love Gogglebox and couldn’t be more excited to be on it with my dad. What an experience it was! Stand Up To Cancer is such an amazing cause and I’m proud to have been asked to be a part of it ♥️ Airs this Friday!!. ...

item.title: Danny Dyer to explore royal roots in new BBC show - Independent.ie
item.description:
Danny Dyer to explore royal roots in new BBC show  Independent.ie

EastEnders star Danny Dyer will explore his royal roots in a new BBC history series. The actor discovered that he was related to Thomas Cromwell, Edward III, William the Conqueror and Henry III on Who Do You Think You Are? in 2016. New two-part series Danny Dyer’s Right Royal Family will see the actor find out who his ancestors were and how they lived, as he immerses himself in the pursuits, passions and lifestyles of his forebears. From the Vikings to the Tudors, Dyer dresses, eats and lives his way through his entire family tree, with his journey a retelling of 800 years of British histor...

item.title: Harry Redknapp early favourite amid I’m A Celebrity rumours - Independent.ie
item.description:
Harry Redknapp early favourite amid I’m A Celebrity rumours  Independent.ie

Harry Redknapp is already being backed to win this year’s I’m A Celebrity … Get Me Out Of Here! after refusing to deny reports that he is heading into the jungle. The 71-year-old football boss hinted that he will take part in the ITV reality series next month when quizzed about it on talkSPORT’s breakfast show, saying: “I’m not allowed to say. “Anything could happen between now and then. I wouldn’t like to bet one way or the other…” Harry Redknapp, left, with his son, Jamie Redknapp (Ian West/PA) Redknapp said he is “trying not to think about it” when asked about jungle critters, and added:...

item.title: Danny Dyer's Right Royal Family: Eastenders star to present new BBC One history series - The Independent
item.description:
Danny Dyer's Right Royal Family: Eastenders star to present new BBC One history series  The Independent

Danny Dyer has been announced as the surprising new face of the BBC's latest history series. Having discovered his royal heritage on Who Do You Think You Are?, the Eastenders actor will experience life as his ancestors did, immersing himself in the pursuits, passions and lifestyles of his forebears. From eating sheep's tongue, as his Viking relatives once did, or learning to hunt like William the Conqueror (his 30x great-grandfather), Dyer will relive 800 years of British history. Danny Dyer on 'Danny Dyer's Right Royal Family' (BBC) “I'm still in shock at the fact that I'm related to such ...

item.title: Shayne Ward wins award for controversial Coronation Street suicide storyline - Independent.ie
item.description:
Shayne Ward wins award for controversial Coronation Street suicide storyline  Independent.ie

Shayne Ward has won a major industry award for a controversial suicide storyline as Coronation Street dominated a soap opera prize ceremony. Ward’s portrayal of suicidal character Aidan Connor earned him Best Soap Exit honour at the Inside Soap Awards. Coronation Street provoked a backlash due to the darkness of the storyline, but it has now been honoured with an award. It was one of numerous honours claimed by the ITV show, which was named Best Soap, and swept the Inside Soap ceremony held at 100 Wardour Street in London. EastEnders lost out on the prize of best soap, but stars Danny Dyer ...

item.description:
Dani Dyer to star on stage with dad Danny Dyer  Independent.ie

Dani Dyer has announced she will be starring alongside her dad Danny Dyer on stage this Christmas. The Love Island winner posted a message on Instagram telling her fans she will be in Nativity! The Musical at the Hammersmith Apollo in December. EastEnders star Danny is also on the bill. item.description:

Dan-tastic! We've been hoping and praying for these two to pair up together for a project and now, finally, we're getting what we asked for! After finding out that their "Kardashian-esque" TV show was actually going to be less Kardashian-esque and more just based on Dani and Jack, it did make us shed a tear as we prayed the Eastenders star would be on the big screen alongside his daughter. item.title: Coronation Street named best soap as show dominates industry awards - Independent.ie
item.description:
Coronation Street named best soap as show dominates industry awards  Independent.ie

Coronation Street has dominated the winners’ list at the Inside Soap awards. The ITV show claimed silverware in seven categories, more than any other soap this year. Winning categories for the show and its talent included Best Soap and Best Actor. The show also claimed honours for the Best Shock Twist, and for having the funniest characters. Held at 100 Wardour Street in central London, the Inside Soap Awards 2018 ceremony saw Emmerdale, EastEnders, Holloyoaks and Doctors honoured for their stars, storylines, and acting. The complete list of winners: Best Actress Emma Atkins (Charity Dingle...

item.title: Danny Dyer to 'inject fun' into history for BBC One - The Guardian
item.description:
Danny Dyer to 'inject fun' into history for BBC One  The Guardian

He captured the nation’s attention in June with an outspoken tirade about Brexit negotiations before a television audience of millions. Now Danny Dyer has been given a role fronting a history series for BBC One. The EastEnders actor will present Danny Dyer’s Right Royal Family as the corporation tried to “inject fun” into some of its factual programming and create “event TV” to combat the rise of streaming rivals such as Netflix. The ancestry show Who Do You Think You Are? revealed last year that Dyer was a descendant of William the Conqueror and Thomas Cromwell. In his new show the actor w...

item.title: Dani Dyer bodies fan who gave out to her for cancelling meet and greet to go on holiday - Her.ie
item.description:
Dani Dyer bodies fan who gave out to her for cancelling meet and greet to go on holiday  Her.ie

Don't mess with Dyer. Or anybody who just needs a bit of a break every now and then. You don't know their story. With all the glory, fame, and sponsorship deals that come with being the winner of Love Island, there also comes stress, inner turmoil, and the unwavering desire to not spend eight hours of your day taking selfies with fans. Not the easiest job in the entire world, we'd say. Dani Dyer confirmed that fact this week when she cancelled a meet and greet in Birmingham last minute "due to illness." The reality star then later shared a photo of herself on a beach with her friend, leadin...

Love Island’s Dani Dyer pranked fans on social media into thinking she has got engaged to boyfriend Jack Fincham. Dani carried out the prank after a listener dared her to (Global). item.title: EastEnders viewers file complaints as Danny Dyer's character is framed as paedophile - Her.ie
item.description:
EastEnders viewers file complaints as Danny Dyer's character is framed as paedophile  Her.ie

Ofcom has received complaints about the latest EastEnders storyline. This week's instalment of the soap saw Mick Carter, played by Danny Dyer, beaten up in prison after being framed as a paedophile. Stuart's friend Fraser was involved in turning all of the inmates against Carter by incorrectly telling them that he was a sex offender. It was Stuart who concocted the plan against Mick, hoping to get the pub landlord out of his sight and keep him in prison. The Daily Star reports that Ofcom received six complaints about the episode which saw Mick beaten for a crime he didn't commit. I can conf...

item.title: Love Island winner Dani Dyer to make stage debut alongside actor father Danny - Independent.ie
item.description:
Love Island winner Dani Dyer to make stage debut alongside actor father Danny  Independent.ie

Love Island star Dani Dyer is set to make her stage debut alongside her actor father. The winner of this year’s reality TV series will be performing with father Danny in a festive musical. Nativity! The Musical will see the pair reflect their real life and play father and daughter in the Christmas show. Dyer will play an aspiring actress under the direction of her agent father in the production at the Eventim Apollo in Hammersmith, London. Danny Dyer will star onstage alongside his daughter (Ian West/PA) She said: “I am so excited to make my stage debut in Nativity, and with my dad, it is g...

item.title: Love Island's Dani Dyer has just revealed possibly the best news EVER - Her.ie
item.description:
Love Island's Dani Dyer has just revealed possibly the best news EVER  Her.ie

Move aside, Kardashians. If there's a massive Love Island shaped hole in your heart since the series came to an end last month, well it looks like you could be in for a massive treat. Yep, Dani Dyer could be getting her own TV show which features not just her other half and fellow Love Islander, Jack Fincham, BUT, also her dad, Danny Dyer. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Dani Dyer (@danidyerxx) on Aug 18, 2018 at 6:45am PDT Speaking on Capital Breakfast yesterday morning with Roman Kemp, the star revealed that there's is talks about a show coming as soon as early 2019. Eeeek. S...

item.title: Danny Dyer thanks David Cameron for his TV Choice Awards win - Independent.ie
item.description:
Danny Dyer thanks David Cameron for his TV Choice Awards win  Independent.ie

EastEnders star Danny Dyer launched a second expletive-ridden attack on former Prime Minister David Cameron as the actor was honoured at the TV Choice Awards. Dyer, who plays Mick Carter, was handed the prize for Best Soap Actor at the ceremony on Monday. The awards, voted for by the public, celebrate the best of the last 12 months in television and see gongs given out in several categories. Giving thanks for the award, Dyer speculated that he may only have received the honour because he “called David Cameron a twat”. Danny Dyer was honoured with a prize at the TV Choice Awards (Ian West/PA...

item.title: Danny Dyer to make first TV appearance with Dani and Jack on Celebrity Juice - Independent.ie
item.description:
Danny Dyer to make first TV appearance with Dani and Jack on Celebrity Juice  Independent.ie

EastEnders actor Danny Dyer is set to make his first TV appearance alongside his daughter Dani and her partner Jack Fincham since the couple won dating show Love Island. The Business star previously appeared alongside his wife Joanne Mas via video link to give his approval of Fincham, rather than appear in the Love Island villa in person. The trio will all be seen together on ITV2’s Celebrity Juice in an episode that will celebrate 10 years since the comedy panel show was first aired. That's right, we're back this September with a BRAND NEW series and it's all kicking off with a 10th Birthd...

item.title: YES! Danny, Dani and Jack are all going to appear on this show together - Her.ie
item.description:
YES! Danny, Dani and Jack are all going to appear on this show together  Her.ie

We can't wait. Dani and Jack were absolute GOLD on Love Island and we basically loved them from the moment they stepped on screen. Dani was just the most adorable woman on Earth and we all loved Jack and his pen salesman job. They were brilliant, funny, and to top it all off, totally in love. Another added extra to what makes them so appealing is that Dani's dad is Danny Dyer, and well, Jack let his feelings known for Dani's dad in the middle of the series. We've been calling out for them all to appear on TV together since Love Island ended, and it seems our dreams have been answered. Accor...

item.title: Edinburgh TV Festival highlights: What you might have missed - Independent.ie
item.description:
Edinburgh TV Festival highlights: What you might have missed  Independent.ie

The Edinburgh TV Festival has wrapped up for another year. The three-day industry event made headlines, with channel bosses and TV stars talking about the future of the industry, their own experiences, and who or what may not appear on our screens again. Here are the highlights from the festival: Dec will not host I’m A Celebrity alone this year “He’s doing really well and everything he needs to do to get better” says Kevin Lygo on Ant McPartlin and adds someone is confirmed to join Dec in the jungle...although he won’t reveal who just yet. #edtvfest #ImACeleb #ITV — EdinburghTVFestival (@E...

item.description:

Gorge. Queen of the villa, Dani Dyer, has been giving us some serious style inspopost villa with her incredible array of cute playsuits and pretty co-ords and her latest ensemble is one we need ASAP. Sharing an image of herself alongside beau and Love Island winner, Jack Fincham - our eyes were firmly fixed on this cute polka dot number spotted on the 22-year-old. item.title: Dani Dyer shares first photo of Jack and Danny Dyer hanging out and ahh, bless them like - Her.ie
item.description:
Dani Dyer shares first photo of Jack and Danny Dyer hanging out and ahh, bless them like  Her.ie

Bless. If there's any moment as defining as the one where your post the first pic of your boyfriend and your dad hanging out, we have yet to experience it. Like, OK maybe this moment is only super significantbecause the boyfriend is Jack Fincham and the dad is Danny Dyer, but whatever, it's a nice thing so let's just go with it. Dani posted a photo of herself, Jack, and Danny this afternoon having a lovely time watching Westham play some football. The lads are decked out in their gear and Dani is rocking the white shorts and crop top combo. Class. Turning @jack_charlesf westham with the pop...

item.title: Danny Dyer has told Jack Fincham: ‘Love ya’ - Independent.ie
item.description:
Danny Dyer has told Jack Fincham: ‘Love ya’  Independent.ie

Dani Dyer has said her screen-hardman father has also declared his love for Jack Fincham. EastEnders star Danny Dyer, 41, who is currently out of the country on holiday, has spoken to the Love Island winner on the phone. Dani said the actor is going to help with her boyfriend’s career. She told Good Morning Britain that her parents “ring us all the time”. EXCLUSIVE: @Dani_MasDyer says her father and Jack have spoken on the phone since leaving the #LoveIsland villa pic.twitter.com/F8oRfUgBnu — Good Morning Britain (@GMB) August 6, 2018 “My dad especially, he’s like ‘Listen, when I come back ...

item.title: Love Island winner Jack Fincham: I can’t wait to finally meet Danny Dyer - Independent.ie
item.description:
Love Island winner Jack Fincham: I can’t wait to finally meet Danny Dyer  Independent.ie

Love Island winner Jack Fincham has said he is excited – not nervous – to finally meet his girlfriend Dani Dyer’s father, Danny Dyer, on Wednesday. Jack won the ITV2 dating series with Dani last week, but has not yet met the EastEnders actor or Dani’s mother, Joanne Mas, apart from via a video call while in the show’s villa, because they have been on holiday in Florida. Jack told ITV’s Good Morning Britain of the impending meeting: “I’m looking forward to that, it’s Dani’s birthday tomorrow. I’ve met the rest of the family, her nan, her granddad – Bruv – and all her friends, it’s just them ...

item.title: Love Island’s Jack serenades Dani on her birthday - Independent.ie
item.description:
Love Island’s Jack serenades Dani on her birthday  Independent.ie

Love Island’s Jack Fincham serenaded girlfriend Dani Dyer on her birthday. A sweet clip posted on Jack’s Instagram Stories shows Dani, who turns 22 today, leaving a house with several bag over her shoulders. As she walks through the gate, Jack sings Happy Birthday to her. “See you later birthday girl,” he says. “I love you, see you later.” “Love you,” she replies. Jack is set to finally meet Dani’s father, actor Danny Dyer, at her birthday celebration. He has not yet met the EastEnders actor or Dani’s mother, Joanne Mas, in person because they have been on holiday in Florida. Earlier, Dani ...

item.title: Jack has ‘lovely evening’ at birthday bash at the Dyer house - Independent.ie
item.description:
Jack has ‘lovely evening’ at birthday bash at the Dyer house  Independent.ie

Love Island’s Jack Fincham has said he had a “lovely evening” at girlfriend Dani’s birthday bash, where he is thought to have met her dad for the first time. Jack has not had the chance to meet EastEnders star Danny Dyer since he and Dani won the ITV2 dating show more than a week ago, as the actor has been on holiday. However, he had indicated that they were set to come face to face on Dani’s 22nd birthday on Wednesday. Jack has now posted a series of pictures of the celebration on Instagram. The first shows Dani in his lap. Lovely evening round Dan’s for her bday , happy birthday beautiful...

item.title: Love Island U.S. looks set to arrive on Irish television - JOE.ie
item.description:
Love Island U.S. looks set to arrive on Irish television  JOE.ie

After the English and Australian versions, there's even more for Love Island fans. When it comes to your own TV preferences, we're very much of the opinion that the idea of 'each to their own' will always apply. Right now, there are literally thousands of TV shows and films that are available at the touch of a button. Feel free to give Love Island a miss. This being said, the show definitely has a unique stranglehold on the public's heart and in the interest of full disclosure, while it's definitely not my cup of tea, I've seen a few episodes. Here's what I think it's about. There's a bunch...

item.title: Love Island’s Jack Fincham opens up about body insecurities in villa - The Independent
item.description:
Love Island’s Jack Fincham opens up about body insecurities in villa  The Independent

Love Island’s Jack Fincham, who won this year’s series with girlfriend Dani Dyer, has opened up about feeling self-conscious about his body while participating in the competition. The lack of body diversity in the reality show has long been noted, with many calling for the programme to feature a greater variety of body types in future. Jack’s slightly softer physique made him stand out from the array of ab-clad male contestants at the beginning of the show, with his charismatic personality and budding romance with Dani making him a fan favourite throughout. - Read more Love Island criticise...

item.title: Love Island Australia is officially coming to the UK - The Independent
item.description:
Love Island Australia is officially coming to the UK  The Independent

Love Island Australia is officially coming to the UK, a mere two weeks after Jack Fincham and Dani Dyer were crowned winners of the British version of the show. Fans of the reality series will be able to feast their eyes on a new lineup of contestants, some of which have been making headlines for their explosive interactions. In June, a video of two of the male contestants aggressively brawling went viral on social media, with many Twitter users expressing their preference for the Australian edition of the show. - Read more Love Island Australia is way more dramatic than the UK's version “U...

item.title: Game for a laugh - ‘I joined Fossett’s Circus and stayed with them for a year’ - Independent.ie
item.description:
Game for a laugh - ‘I joined Fossett’s Circus and stayed with them for a year’  Independent.ie

'He's going on holidays tomorrow," the PR person whispers anxiously to my instructor, as I am helped up on to the tightrope. "Don't let him break a leg." Holidays be damned. I stride across the rope undaunted. I'm fearless. I'm committed. I laugh in the face of danger. Jack declared the couple will tie the knot in 2019, while Dani – daughter of EastEnders star Danny Dyer – said they would be moving in together after the summer. item.title: Love Island’s class of 2018 set for reunion show - Independent.ie
item.description:
Love Island’s class of 2018 set for reunion show  Independent.ie

The contestants from this year’s series of dating show Love Island will be getting back together on Sunday for a one-off reunion show. On Monday Dani Dyer and her partner Jack Fincham were voted the winning couple and split the £50,000 winners’ prize money, at the climax of what was a record-breaking series for ITV2. The final was the channel’s most-watched programme ever, with an average of 3.6 million viewers tuning in. Out for a lovely meal at @sheeshchigwell x A post shared by Jack Fincham (@jack_charlesf) on Aug 4, 2018 at 7:49am PDT Now the programme’s 2018 alumni will be joining pres...

item.title: Love Island winners 'getting married next year' - RTÉ News
item.description:
Love Island winners 'getting married next year'  RTÉ News

Love Island winners Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham have set wedding bells ringing already, with the pair saying they are "getting married next year, 100 per cent." The couple were the landslide winners of this year's Love Island, with sparks having flown between the two upon entering the villa two months ago. Having already made their relationship official, said 'I love you' and discussed plans to live together after the show ended, while still filming the reality series, it shouldn't come as much of a surprise to fans that they are already talking about taking more serious steps. "We're gettin...

item.title: Danny Dyer congratulates his daughter on Love Island win - Independent.ie
item.description:
Danny Dyer congratulates his daughter on Love Island win  Independent.ie

Danny Dyer has congratulated his daughter after she was named the winner of ITV reality TV show Love Island. Dani Dyer, 22, was crowned the winner along with her boyfriend, Jack Fincham. The pair had been the bookmakers’ favourites from early on and walked away with a cheque for £50,000. Shortly after news of their triumph was announced on ITV2 on Monday, Dani’s EastEnders actor father posted a short clip to his Instagram story congratulating her on the win. Danny Dyer has congratulated his daughter after she won Love Island (Matt Crossick/PA Wire Standing next to his wife and Dani’s mother...

item.title: Dani and Jack talk marriage as Love Island wraps up with reunion show - Independent.ie
item.description:
Dani and Jack talk marriage as Love Island wraps up with reunion show  Independent.ie

Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham have confirmed they are going to get married – just not yet. The smitten couple revealed on the Love Island reunion show that they are currently looking at houses so they can move in together and that although they are planning to tie the knot it will not be in the next year. “Marriage is stress,” said Dani. “I will stress out, I’ll be Bridezilla!” The couple said they are still struggling to believe that they won the series. “It doesn’t feel real,” said Dani, while Jack agreed: “I can’t believe it.” They also discussed their strong feelings for each other and Dan...

item.title: Love Island winner Jack says he will marry co-star Dani Dyer 'next year' - The Telegraph
item.description:
Love Island winner Jack says he will marry co-star Dani Dyer 'next year'  The Telegraph

Love Island's landslide winners Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham are "getting married next year". Jack declared the couple will tie the knot in 2019, while Dani – daughter of EastEnders star Danny Dyer – said they would be moving in together after the summer. The victorious couple and their fellow finalists arrived back in the UK amid joyful scenes at London Stansted Airport on Tuesday afternoon. Hundreds of fans, along with family, friends and members of the media, turned out to welcome them home. Revealing his marriage plans, Jack, 26, told The Sun: "We're getting married next year, 100 per cen...

item.title: 6 essential moments from the penultimate episode of Love Island - Her.ie
item.description:
6 essential moments from the penultimate episode of Love Island  Her.ie

Day 48. It is with a heavy heart I must announce that Love Islandis finally coming to a close. The finale airs tonight and although the inevitable winners (Jack and Dani) could've been crowned as far back as week one, it's nice that we had a small distraction from our impending mortality for the past two months. Last night's episode was the golden snitch ofLove Islandcontent because we got to park our fascination with making fun of the islanders and instead switch our efforts to making fun of their parents instead. Danny Dyer appeared via satellite and it made the past eight weeks of loyal ...

item.title: Danny Dyer warns Love Island’s Jack: Don’t make my daughter cry - Independent.ie
item.description:
Danny Dyer warns Love Island’s Jack: Don’t make my daughter cry  Independent.ie

Danny Dyer has warned Love Island’s Jack Fincham that there will be “issues” if he hurts his daughter, Dani. Jack and Dani, who are the favourites to win in Monday’s final of the dating show, have been an item since the start of the series, and the EastEnders actor has given Jack his seal of approval. But Dyer has said that if the stationery salesman makes his daughter cry, he will be in trouble. Love Island’s Jack Fincham and Dani Dyer (ITV) The soap star told the Daily Mirror: “If a tear drops from my daughter’s eye, then there is going to be issues. “Listen, Jack – just look after her an...

item.title: WATCH: Danny Dyer finally made an appearance on Love Island - JOE.ie
item.description:
WATCH: Danny Dyer finally made an appearance on Love Island  JOE.ie

And he did not disappoint... Danny Dyer has had a bit of an eventfulsummer. He appeared on ITV about a month ago to offer his expert opinion on everything from David Cameron (he called him a twat), to football, to Brexit. His take on Brexit is exactly what you'd expect it to be too, and also surprisingly accurate. And since then he has been in the public eye again. His daughter, also named Dani, has been one of the stars of this year's Love Island. Dani has been coupling up with a guy called Jack and the pair have been universally loved by fans of the show. They have remained drama free thr...

item.title: Danny Dyer congratulates daughter Dani on Love Island success - The Telegraph
item.description:
Danny Dyer congratulates daughter Dani on Love Island success  The Telegraph

Danny Dyer has congratulated his daughter after she was named the winner of ITV reality TV show Love Island. Dani Dyer, 22, was crowned the winner along with her boyfriend, Jack Fincham. The pair had been the bookmakers' favourites from early on and walked away with a cheque for £50,000. Shortly after news of their triumph was announced on ITV2 on Monday, Dani's EastEnders actor father posted a short clip to his Instagram story congratulating her on the win. Standing next to his wife and Dani's mother, Joanne Mas, Dyer said: "Dan, you have done it! We cannot wait, we are coming to see you."...

item.title: Love Island fans react to Danny Dyer Skyping into the show - The Independent
item.description:
Love Island fans react to Danny Dyer Skyping into the show  The Independent

It can't be easy having one of the most nerve-racking moments of any relationship - meeting the parents - broadcast on national television, much less when the father you're meeting is one Danny Dyer. Though the Eastenders star wasn't able to visit the Love Island villa in person, he dropped in via Skype to surprise his daughter Dani and deliver his verdict on her new man Jack. Fortunately, Danny seems to have taken a shine to him, declaring Jack to be "absolutely bang on" and even going so far as to admire Jack's belly, which he said in the comparison to the others: "they’re all abbed up bu...
